Key Match Events: The Dodgers came back from a five-run deficit to win the World Series
Freddie Freeman drove in 12 runs in the series
Blake Treinen threw 2.1 innings without allowing a run
Mookie Betts made a crucial catch in the top of the 8th inning
Austin Verdugo hit a game-tying sacrifice fly in the top of the 8th inning
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts said the trophy belongs to everybody
Freddie Freeman said the World Series trophy is everything he's ever wanted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers won their 8th World Series title
The game was played at Yankee Stadium
The Dodgers had a loaded roster and were an extraordinary club
Manager Dave Roberts was tremendous pulling the strings for the Dodgers in the series
